Package javelin.model.world.location.dungeon

Class Dungeon

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.Dungeon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TempleDungeon
    public class Dungeon
extends Location
    A dungeon is an underground area of the world where the combats are harder but have extra treasure laying around. The in-game logic for dungeons is that they are a hideout of bandits or similar, which is why they are sacrificeable by Incursions and are removed from the game after a Squad leaves one (in this case it's assumed the bandits packed their stuff and left).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • encounters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Combatants> encounters
        Table of encounters to roll from when generating RandomDungeonEncounters. Entries can be set to null when certain encounters are pacified. If rolled, these will result in skipped encounters (ie: the Squad met them but they weren't hostile). Pacified encounters do not carry over to the next level.
        See Also:
        Leader

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(int attackel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion.reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()
